reply: Thank you for taking time to provide your feedback. We hate to hear your frustration, and we are sorry for the negative experience. We would like to make things right. Please call us at 1-800-LEXMARK (1-800-539-6275) Monday-Friday 8:00am to 9:00pm EST so we can assist you.

title: Printer setup is so straight forward and print quality is great as well
body: I was nervous getting this printer due to other reviews of it being extremely difficult to set up to WiFi, I even purchased a direct chord for it just in case. But it was extremely straight forward. I recommend scanning the support QR code provided on the sheet of safety hazards and then watch the videos for setting up the printer and wifi. Follow the video step by step and pause as you go. Also the printer does come with ink.

title: Too hard to install and doesn't work with WiFi
body: Do not buy this printer It is a nightmare to install. After 3 days of tech support, the printer did not work. They are sending a new one. But I still may return it anyway. Its total overkill, don't know how it works and it's too big and heavy with no install instructions. The people at the tech support are great, but the printer still doesnt work. Still trying to hook it up.
reply: Thank you for taking time to write a review. We are sorry to hear about your disappointment with the printer, it’s not the kind of experience we wanted you to feel. And thank you for noticing the added weight from steel we put into the device’s frame in-order to create a business class, robust product.

title: Complicated
body: I do not want a replacement! I want my money back added to my card!!!

title: Don't buy its a hassle to use
body: So before you buy this printer let me tell you about my issues i had. First i had plugged it in follow the pictures that were given for instructions. (Note: there is no words for the instructions) After i had done so i downloaded the app that it told me to however in the Google play store i did not download the Lexmark printer assistant app which i needed to set it up. I had downloaded the Lexmark print app which was not of help since the printer was not even connected to my WiFi at this point. It took me a good 2 hours just to figure that part out. Then after getting the printer on the WiFi network and all set up on the phone i go to set up on the computer. I have an HP running windows 10 home edition. It took me 4 hours just to get the drivers installed onto the computer and for it to recognized that i had a printer on the WiFi network. I can get test page to print just fine however what i had printed for an actual test print did not print it said error printer offline. The printer clearly says on the little 2 line screen "Ready". I started this task at 10:30 am Arizona time it is now 9:33 pm and what i had sent to the printer as a test print is now being printed on its own without my computer being on. Now if only it would print when i tell it to and print the full page not just a half page like the picture i uploaded for reference. JUST DON'T BUY THIS SAVE YOU SELF AND GET A BETTER ONE THAT SOMEONE CAN VOUCH FOR IT.
reply: We are sorry to hear about your negative experience with the printer. We understand your disappointment and we apologize for the inconvenience it has caused you. If you can give us a call at 1-800-LEXMARK (1-800-539-6275, option 1) Monday-Friday 8:00am to 9:00pm EST, we would like to check your printer settings and make sure it is configured correctly

title: Good print quality, Couldn't get wifi to work
body: I bought this printer for the home "print a few times a year" use-case after getting tired of dried out inkjet printers.Pros:Print quality looks good. Ethernet connection worked pretty good.Cons:I could not get wi-fi to work with my router. Some other reviews suggested static IP address. Didn't help for me, there was some connection but it wasn't solid enough to be usable. I think I'm just going to have to use it over ethernet.

title: Stopped working.  Memory Full. No solution.
body: Like most printers. It worked great for months and then just decided to stop working. I've spent the last 2 hours trouble shooting and refraining from going full OFFICE SPACE on this thing. It is displaying "MEMORY FULL". I've erased the memory. Restarted. Manually put in WiFi password and restarted again. And still it refuses to print. Always a job you need printed immediately. smh.Could not get a hold of tech support. They do not make it easy.
reply: Thank you for the feedback. Lexmark products are designed and tested for quality and reliability so we understand your frustration. We value our customers and would like to see if we can assist you, but we need more information in order to help. Our technical support line is open Monday-Friday, 8:00am to 9:00pm EST. You can contact them at 1-800-LEXMARK (1-800-539-6275) option 1.

title: WTH????
body: ink replacement program is not accepting any new comers, yet they still sell the product.... It costs less to buy a whole new printer than to replace the ink. Great!! now we will have tons of printers stacked all over the place.!!!🤷‍♀️

title: Look for replacement toner before buying this printer
body: It's a great printer. Fast, does a beautiful job, no sarcasm here.At the time of this writing, it costs under $200. Replacement toner from Amazon (cyan, yellow, magenta, black) is $335. ???

title: Good quality and heavy
body: Like about good quality but cartridge expensive

title: Great for home office use I would not suggest using this for business
body: So firstly I want to start off by saying there are a lot of negative reviews on this that are literally unjustified. These are usually problems with the toner cartridge or people fail to properly follow the directions on initial setup. In addition I can vouch that the Wi-Fi on this does work flawlessly with almost every device I've used it on I have yet to test it with Alexa but we'll be doing so after I write a skill set for it. I have enclosed a bunch of photos a picture of the Disney Castle is printed on Plain paper and the other image was printed on photo paper So now onto my review...So in this review I'm going to address three areas the printer quality, the print quality, and the cost of use. First let's start with the overall quality this seems to be like every other laser printer as far as the overall housing internal components seem to be primarily plastic which is normal 4 most printers in its class. It does not come with a USB plug although one can be purchased. It does come with a power cord. The toner tray slides out from the front and the clips that lock the toner in place are made out of plastic so over a long. Of time they could present a problem and possibly break off. I would not say this is a deal-breaker. Does printer stands 9 in tall and is 16 in wide and is approximately 15 and 1/2 in deep. It contains built in Wi-Fi and has a port for ethernet. This has a port for USB but does not contain the USB cord itself. In addition does does have a manual feeder tray which is located in the front and it also has the automatic sheet feed tray which is just under it . You can print small photographs using 4 x 6 in Premium Photo Paper . But I have not tried anything smaller than this as far as paper is concerned . Envelope printing is also excellent and will leave absolutely zero creases in the envelope compared to most other Laser Printers. This comes with for starter toner cartridges which come already in the printer. You must follow the setup directions very closely to avoid damaging the product. This does come with a CD with drivers and software. Now moving on to the print quality compared to some of the competitors this print quality is actually really decent when compared to Samsung HP and brother Laser Printers in its class.. this printer that I received had very limited instructions which I was kind of surprised at. Especially for Lexmark. In my eyes this look like a factory recert where they had printed documentation off of a printer and enclosed it. But none the less was very easy to set up and all of the user manuals and Owner Manuals can be downloaded directly from Lexmark website. Moving on to the value I only gave this three stars for a couple of reasons first the product as compared to others of its class is very cheap I think I paid approximately $140 for this whereas most printers in this class range about $200 or more so that in itself is a great deal moving on to the second reason after doing an ample amount of research I have found that the toner cartridges are quite expensive to replace. For a refill directly from Lexmark it cost approximately $70 per cartridge. Other sites I have found the refill toner cartridges to be anywhere from $200 per set, up to literally almost $400 for the set of cartridges. in addition to this if you have the knowledge to do so you can purchase a toner refill kit. I have found the cheapest price to be approximately $70 this includes all four colors however the caveat is there is no toner reset chip available at this time. Although several reviews for toner refill on this specific printer have all said that it will let you print even after the chip is considered depleted I feel you must research it yourself once the toner chips are made available they are very easy to replace and you could reuse your toner cartridges for a long time. On that note I would say for a general home office printer this is a very good purchase if you are planning on purchasing this for business use I would suggest not going with this printer and going with a brother as the toner cartridges and chips are much cheaper and they have been in business far longer than Lexmark and their parts are made with much higher quality with businesses in mind.

title: Works well just can’t stay connected to network
body: When I purchased this product I was in need of a printer it works well for my home office it will not stay connected to the network and I’m not tech savvy enough to figure out why print quality is great I wouldn’t recommend that this is the best option just a last resort purchase

title: Do not recommend!!!
body: Literally have only printed maybe 20 pages and already have terrible print quality.
reply: We are sorry to hear about your experience. We appreciate you taking time to provide your feedback. Lexmark products are designed and tested for quality and reliability – and your device comes with a standard one-year warranty. title: Would not buy.
body: It’s only the 3rd month and there is a horrible noise when it runs the pages
reply: Thank you for taking time to provide your feedback. We value our customers and would like to see if we can assist you. Our technical support line is open Monday-Friday, 8:00am to 9:00pm EST. You can contact them at 1-800-LEXMARK (1-800-539-6275) option 1. Please give us a call and we will work to eliminate the horrible noise!

title: Setup/Installation is Horrible
body: Why didn't I read more reviews and answered questions before I made this purchase? This was one of the most frustrating installations I've ever had. I had to download 2 different Lexmark apps to attempt to connect via Wifi and that didn't work. I have a Mac and I downloaded the drivers and nothing worked. After over 2 hours of trying, the next day I purchased a USB cord to make a connection and that worked. The test page was a blurry joke AND I don't want to use a cord in order to print. Can't wait until Monday when UPS picks up this monstrous printer and ships it back!
reply: Thank you for the feedback. We hate to hear that you had multiple issues while installing the printer, but we do want to help you and get connected. If you haven’t yet returned, please give us a call at 1-800-LEXMARK (1-800-539-6275) Monday-Friday 8:00am to 9:00pm EST. We would like to get more details on the issue and help you resolve the situation and relieve your frustration.

title: Couldn't install
body: Couldn't get off to work with computer. No instructions for install. Help center couldn't help either.
reply: Thank you for your feedback regarding the challenge in setting up your printer. We do have available instructions online. You can go to our website and type in your printer model (C3224dw) for product manuals, How To Videos and other documentations. You may also contact us at 1-800-LEXMARK (1-800-539-6275) Monday-Friday 8:00am to 9:00pm EST and request to escalate the ticket to higher level, if the support agent was not able to assist you.

title: WIFI connection issues and huge setup issues, print cartridges are expensive
body: I really made an effort to connect but the printer has serious WIFI connectivity issues. Setup was 2 days of hassle and then once I partially got it working, the printer would go sleep and disconnect from the network and my computer. Tech support said to set up a static IP address but would not tell me how to do that because I need to call Netgear (maker of my router). What a HUGE pain.The instruction manual was a joke of some photocopied pics (no words) and scanning the QR page took me to support but not drivers. They do give you a CD with drivers but who has a CD player anymore. Finally, the printer comes with "starter" laser cartridges that are almost empty. New ones are close to $300 on amazon. The print quality was good for plain paper. The last thing is it looks like I received a returned printer because I noticed finger print smudges on menu. Other user probably had similar issues.

title: Awesome printer !
body: Printer makes clean clear prints. However since I am not a whiz when it comes to hooking things up I had to go to the website to get more detailed instructions on setting it up. I’m very happy with the quality!

title: $75-$100+ PER toner cartridge for replacements.
body: Yeah I was a fool.I didn't check the toner prices first.The manufacturer's website shows $65 for the Black, and $75 for each color, + shipping + tax.Everywhere else is more expensive.There's no copy-cat toner for this that I see.BEING SHOWN color toner at reasonable prices while buying this... toner that is INCOMPATIBLE with this printer... is the hallmark of the crappy suggestion AI/engine found here... and drives people like me up the wall.If I am LOOKING for a specified IN-THE-FILTER brand, I don't want to see another.If I am LOOKING at a specific MODEL, DON'T SHOW ME SUPPLIES for other MODELS!It really is a garbage suggestion AI/engine!And it has now gotten this printer 1-star!And a probable RETURN.

title: Awful, and a disappointing purchase.
body: Going back. Set up is a joke even for myself who is somewhat tech savvy. Set up a static ip and still issues.

title: Good Printer poor OS integration
body: I like the printer but they use the buggiest and slowest android operation system. I think they were lazy to intergrade their own GUI and OS. Overall thou it work as intend. Sleep mode doesn't really work, in the middle of the night it would just turn on and off. Because of the OS the touch screen is so slow press one button and wait for the next menu.

title: Incredible lack of support / documentation / software
body: It is borderline criminal that a company as large as Lexmark can sell such a poorly supported and poorly documented device. While the basic printing quality is good, the software - both that which comes with the printer and that which is available online - is pure garbage. I used this printer with a 2 year old laptop running Windows 10 Home. The laptop works fine. But connecting the printer was a nightmare. No confirmation that the drivers install, an arcane flash update procedure, and partially installed features that do not fully load into the OS.Worst of all, the scanning feature appears to no longer be supported by Lexmark and not compatible with Windows 10. There is more information on line about how the scanner does not work than there is information, of ANY SORT, from Lexmark on how to connect, check, and interface with the scanner.Stay away from this piece of junk - it is just not worth the hassle. I have purchased about 2 dozen Lexmark printers for my factory over the past 10 years or so. They work great. But this home model is just a pure piece of garbage.

title: Quality
body: Excellent quality....easy to use...

title: Works with no issues and setup quickly.
body: This device works well in my small office for three users. Starts quickly from sleep, prints and scans fast and clearly. No issues and would purchase again if needed.

title: Good product
body: Set up difficulty

title: Great all in one printer
body: Works great!!! Cheaper than Office depot

title: Love it
body: This is a good product, we have always stuck with the Lexmark printers because if you have a printer that fails you can transfer it to any different Lexmark printer and it prints perfectly clear, whereas if you transfer it to a different mfg printer it often times gets glitches because of printer driver translations

title: Not sure...
body: ...what all the complaints are about? This printer, once set up for your respective platform, works flawlessly. I have even connected my family's tablets and cell phones. The duplex scanning and scan to email are exactly what we needed. I guess it's a case of "beauty in the eye of the beholder." We've had a great experience with this very fast, capable printer. Wait for a price dip though...it seems to vary considerably on Amazon.

title: Didn't work with system
body: Wouldn't work, tech support tried to help. Returned

title: Worst scanning machine EVER!!!
body: My boss bought the Lexmark MB2442 for our medical practice. It is the most computer stupid machine I have ever worked with, especially the scanning process. There is at least a 5 second busy signal between each page scanned and then you have to hit ok to complete the scan and then you have to press 3 buttons to scan the next piece of paper...I want to kill myself! The machine is bumbly, slow and NOT WORTHY!

title: Useless printer
body: This printer is completely inoperable, from the internet connection to the physical aspect, nothing worked. The CD that came with it was only legally informative. There was no owners manual. The downloaded supposedly operative apps did not work. SMPT or whatever it was did not work. Nothing worked. No phone numbers to call. I was all on my own. Thank God I now have HP which set up was as smooth as velvet. I have no ratings at all for this printer. It was below any rating star.

title: Fast, Great Print Quality, Decent Scanning, Finicky Wireless
body: The Lexmark MB2338adw is a solid choice for home office and small office environments. On the plus side, it offers great versatility -- duplex printing, scanning, fax, and more. The print quality is strong for businesses purposes, with clean and sharp text. It's very fast and works best through a wired connection.The scanning quality isn't the greatest. If this will be the only scanner in the office then don't expect the best images. It's absolutely fine for scanning text, but anything with images and you'll notice a decline in quality.As mentioned before, this printer works best through a wired connections -- both USB and ethernet are fine. While it does work wirelessly, getting it to work and stay online can be a struggle. If wireless is a must, there are definitely better options out there.As with most electronics, the Lexmark MB2338adw is a compromise. If you need a fast and versatile printer then it's certainly worth a look. If you need strong scanning and wireless functionality then you're better off passing on this one.

title: Reliability
body: Quality and value for the money. I Have been using this unit for more than a year now with no problems.

title: Good for printing / bad for scanning
body: Regular printing works well but scan quality is comparable to a fax machine. The second issue is that it takes up to 20 seconds before the scanning starts which feels like an eternity. We worked with Lexmark Support for a few hours and nothing helped. They eventually replaced it but the new unit does the same thing. We purchased the MB2442 and it works much better.

title: worked less than an year with minimal use
body: Worked less than a year with appearance of low-no ink printing even with new ink cartridges. Not a high volume office needing less than 20 pages printed 4 days a week. I do not recommend and would not buy again.

title: NOT USER FRIENDLY! NO INSTRUCTIONS! DOES NOT SCAN
body: I am returning this horrible thing! It does print and copy amazing but IMPOSSIBLE to set up for scanning. It came with no set up instructions at all. I have literally spent over 12 hours trying to figure out how to get the scan function with no luck. Tech support is horrible spent 2 hours on hold till finally hung up.

title: Terrible Piece of Equipment
body: This is truly the worst piece of computer equipment I have ever purchased in my life. I am not a novice to computers or computer related equipment. I can usually figure out how to get a printer working rather quickly and painlessly. This printer has been nothing but a headache since I bought it. It has never consistently been able to connect to my network with a cable. The WIFI never worked, despite hours of research. Forget trying to contact Lexmark customer support. They make it so difficult to find a number, I wish I had never wasted the time in the first place. Lexmark should be ashamed to sell a product such as this.

title: Great Monochrome Laser Printer!
body: I'm still learning a lot things this printer can do. I never realized much of an advantage scanning option was. Printing quality is great, admittedly, it is mono or black & white. Most of what I did was black & white. A lot of black & white, I went through one 6K printer cartridge in a month. Great printer!

title: A warehouse workhorse with wireless printing.
body: Four stars:• This is a very good entry level laser printer for a commercial enterprise.• It would also be great in the warehouse for printing packing slips, invoices, etc.• It only has a single paper tray, but it holds 250 sheets.• Toner refills are expensive but Lexmark has a cartridge return program that helps.• Production is high quality with good toner saturation and a fast page per minute pace.• It is somewhat compact and weighs a lot.• There isn’t much in the way of instructions.• There’s a CD included for installation, but we got the drivers online.Five stars:• Wireless printing.• Super high Lexmark quality. It’s built like a tank.• An efficient and effective modern update.

title: 1st and probably the last
body: Lexmark customer service IS HORRIBLE! The first Printer I received was not printing properly. 2 DAYS for them to call back. Thankfully AMAZON is AMAZING and replaced the printer. This one works wonderfully, but it I have any problems, ugg it may not be good.

title: Problems After One Year - Will Be Discontinued in 2020
body: I purchased the MX417DE on May 3, 2018. It worked great. I work from home as an Adjunct Professor. I am also a doctoral student. I print a lot. My in-box toner lasted for approximately 8 months. I purchased another toner in January, 2019. Last week (the week of July 8th), my printer began to print faded pages as if the toner was low. However, the diagnostics indicated that I had 80% toner remaining. I contacted Lexmark. They indicated it was a Toner problem. So, I purchased a new toner directly from Lexmark for $240.00. The toner was not the problem. So, they indicated it was the Transfer Roller. I purchased that for $25+. That was not the problem. Since my Lexmark warranty was expired, I contacted Square Trade (An Allstate Company) who held my extended warranty. They determined it was a hardware problem (after one year of having the printer). They offered me a cash-out or a replacement printer. I chose the cash out (5 to 7 business days). I contacted Lexmark to order a replacement. I was informed that if I contacted presales, I could get 30% off a new printer to help mitigate some of the cost because the cost of the printer had gone up since I purchased it. When I contacted presales, they informed me that the MX models would be discontinued next year and therefore, I could only purchase them directly from a dealer (without the 30% discount). That irritated me. They offered me a different model which was double the price of the previous printer. Plus, it was not compatible with the toner (80% full) that I already have, which means that I will lose all of that toner. They are going to refund my new toner purchase plus the transfer roller purchase. However, I will have to eat the 80% remaining toner that I will not be able to use unless I go to a dealer to have them repair the printer, possibly costing more than the value of the printer, given that the warranty is gone and the model will be discontinued next year. With the exception of one customer service person, all seven of the other Lexmark staff in orders, presales, parts, and tech support were either incompetent or rude. Dana at Lexmark was great. Allison was okay as well. Of course, she only transferred me back to Dana. Everyone else needs additional training or a new job. This was the worst week in customer service incompetence I have ever experienced. And I have experienced a lot of bad customer service. Believe me! Plus, I will be upside down $300.00 even after the refunds and discounts. Go figure! Just know that if you are thinking about purchasing any Lexmark MX models, they will soon be discontinued. Also, many of the Lexmark customer service people are either incompetent or rude. I would take a rude competent person if I had to choose. But incompetence is not something that I can tolerate (Heavy sigh)! If the MX models are experiencing hardware problems after one year, then perhaps it is better that they be discontinued. So, the replacement model that I ordered, which has not yet arrived is MB2546ADWE. Just FYI! I hope this helps, despite the rant.

title: Very capable office printer!
body: The Lexmark MB2442adwe is a great choice for a small office or a workgroup. It is a monochrome printer, so it might not be the best choice for a home printer. However, if you are satisfied that you don't need/want to print color at home, it would make a great home machine too. It feels very sturdy and well-made.This all-in-one prints at up to 42ppm, and is rated for a monthly print volume of up to 10,000 pages, so it should be up to the demands of most small offices. In testing, it reached (or at least came pretty close) to the 42ppm. I had no desire to burn through 20 or so reams of paper though, so I can't vouch for the monthly volume rating. Print quality was outstanding and it presented no problems using AirPrint from an iPhone or iPad. Setup was a breeze (with Macs, anyway; we don't have any Windows PCs), both wireless and using Ethernet. The instructions are clear and relatively concise. The MB2442adwe prints its first page quickly, too, usually spitting out the first page 7-8 seconds after hitting, "print."It has a couple of features that are very helpful in an office environment. The first is the ability to print securely. If you select this option in the print job dialog, your job won't print until you go to the printer and enter a PIN you selected when printing. This is very useful to ensure that sensivive documents don't print until you are physically at the printer waiting for them. The second is the ability to add an additional, 550-page capacity, input tray. The built-in tray holds 250 sheets, plus there is the usual multi-purpose feeder (which in the MB2442adwe holds 100 pages, more than these typically can handle). The addition of an extra input tray can either give you access to an additional paper size/type, or just add extra capacity of a single size so you don't have to refill as often.There are a couple of things that are less than optimal, however. The first is this cryptic note in the "Specs" section on the Lexmark website: "Product functions only with replacement cartridges designed for use in a specific geographical region." This appears to mean that replacement cartridges are locked to a specific region, sort of like DVDs; I've personally never heard of this and am just speculating. That may or may not be an issue, but is something you should be aware of.The second is that, while the printer is well-suited for a moderate to heavy burden of office printing, the scanner and copier are not if you are scanning or copying duplex documents. It scans duplex, to be sure. However, it does this by way of RADF (Reversing Automatic Document Feeder). This means that it scans one side of the page, ejects that page not quite all the way, then re-feeds it to scan the other side. Essentially, it takes twice as long to scan a 2-sided document as it does a single-sided one. The ideal scanners and copiers have true Duplex Automatic Document Feeders (DADF), with two scanning elements so that both sides of the page are scanned during a single pass. This is not an issue unless you have a heavy scanning or copying volume, AND a great percentage of that volume consists of documents printed on both sides. The ADF holds 50 pages, more than most printers intended for home use, which is consistent with its office-focused design.The price of this printer is quite reasonable for the quality and capacity you get in the printing area, so it stands to reason money would have to be saved somewhere, and it was in the scanning/copying functions. That being said, the scanner is plenty fast, so you may very well find this to be a non-issue. However, it is something else you should be aware of.The all-in-one also sends and receives faxes, but I don't have a landline, so I couldn't test either.Overall, this is a great printer, especially for the price. I would have no hesitation to use it in my office.

title: Terrible printer!!

title: Fast easy setup, fast easy printing, low noise—AirPrint for Apple
body: So far, this is a fantastic printer. The setup wizard makes this very easy to set up using an iPhone. Our family has 4 iPhones, 5 iPads, and 2 iPod touches, AirPrint is a critical component for us. Our previous printer is the Ricoh in the second photo. It prints nice quality for cheap, but it’s miserable to use with apple devices.This Lexmark is a perfect and seamless component in our home apple ecosystem. There is one small trick, make sure your device is on the same WiFi network as the printer, otherwise no available printer will show up in your printer options. We have Fios by Frontier, and they provide a wireless router, but we have a much better Orbi home network we use. So with two different WiFi options, it can get a little confusing, because your device may auto select either network, but your printer will only use the network you chose on setup. If you have problems with AirPrint, check your WiFi settings.This Lexmark is much quieter than the outgoing Ricoh, and has a much smaller power draw. It warms up much faster, and prints much faster. Our old Ricoh would dim the lights during its 50 second warm up cycle, this Lexmark barely makes a sound, and completes warm up in well under 10 seconds. So if power draw on an overloaded circuit, or noise, are factors for you, you’ll appreciate this as much as I do.

title: Outstanding All In One!
body: I love this thing! I replaced an older Brother AIO with this and let me tell you...WHAT A DIFFERENCE! I had no trouble with setup (just followed the online manual) and was literally up and running in about 30 minutes. I tried it with both wired (USB) and wireless WiFi printing and had absoultely no issues whatsoever. Prints are great looking and lightning fast. I was also able to print direct from my iPhone without issue.The only thing I wasn't able to test was fax, as I don't have a landline. But I have no doubt it would work just fine.Great AIO for the money!

title: False Advertising
body: This product initially appeared to work well, however, it is no longer compatible with Apple's most recent upgrades and will no longer function. After lengthy discussions with Lexmark (see list of discussions below) and the insurance Asurion, unfortunately, this issue continues to remain open and now over a week later, the printer is still not functional and we continue to get the run around with various members of customer service. I have requested a refund for the product and strongly discourage the purchase of any products from this company.cjumalon@lexmark.com - "Cherryl"Timeline from start to current:- approximately 11/13 - updated to Mojave. Scanner stopped working.- approximately 11/20 - Downloaded latest firmware from Lexmark.com for printer, hoping that would fix the scanner. Then the printer stopped working.- approximately 11/27 - contacted lexmark by phone for help. (played phone tag with multiple people)- approximately 11/30 - called Asurion and on phone with them troubleshooting.. no solution. They mailed us a box a few days later to return printer in - "if we damage it and don't package it right, that's our fault..."- 12/3, 3pm - Pat took a message.- 12/3, 5:18pm - Marvin took a message. Mailed us new toner (when new toner arrived, printer started working; scanner still wouldn't work).- 12/4, 9:26am - Surgeon took a message.- 12/5, 11:23am - received voicemail from Nali/Gali - "still need help?"- 12/5, 3:45pm - Luise - "yes, we still need help."- 12/7, 9:40am - Angel - "you're on our priority list."(Starting now, they'd remote into the computer and would ensure nothing abnormal was happening with the printer... installing and uninstalling printer software multiple times... restarting... asking me to change settings on the printer... I couldn't use the computer at these times)- 12/10 - Rey - escalated to next level of support. Spent 1:11 hours on the line. "It's not a problem with the printer..."- 12/11, 10:40am - Rey - working with "level 3 technician" - (length unsure... probably an hour).- 12/11, 1:40pm - Rey - second phone call - I scanned 2 print outs to them from my phone.- 12/11, 3pm - Jalil - another hour on phone. Scanned another print out to them from my phone.- 12/13 - Cherryl - spent 2:40 hours on phone. Scanned another print out to them from my phone. For whatever reason, when she was working on the computer, she changed a setting and now the printer doesn't work again...Status - Cherryl (cjumalon@lexmark.com) said she's going to escalate this to the top most experts, the software engineers. They're going to test this in a lab to try to replicate it. And if they can't figure out a solution, they'll write a special code for us and it will fix the scanner.

title: Good economy printer for office, but with limitations
body: The MB2338adw is a good choice for a small office or a workgroup where up-front cost is important and your needs are mainly for printing only. It prints a more-than-adequate 36ppm. It has an automatic document feeder (ADF). However, the ADF is not a duplex scanner. It does print duplex automatically, however. If you are scanning or copying 2-sided documents, you will have to scan one side, then turn it over and scan the other side. Not practical for anything other than occasional use. Essentially, the MB2338adw is positioned as a budget alternative to the more full-featured MB2442adwe, with a slightly slower print speed (36ppm vs 40), lower recommended monthly duty cycle rating (6,000 pages vs. 10,000), no secure print capability, and the lack of a duplex ADF being the primary differences. However, for an average price difference of only around $40, I'm not sure the tradeoffs are worth the modest price reduction.It is a monochrome printer, so it might not be the best choice for a home printer. However, if you are satisfied that you don't need/want to print color at home, it would work at home too. It feels very sturdy and well-made.In testing, it reached (or at least came pretty close) to the 36ppm. I had no desire to burn through 15 or so reams of paper though, so I can't vouch for the monthly volume rating. Print quality was outstanding and it presented no problems using AirPrint from an iPhone or iPad. Setup was a breeze (with Macs, anyway; we don't have any Windows PCs), both wireless and using Ethernet. The instructions are clear and relatively concise (though they are primary illustrated; no/little text). The MB2338adw prints its first page quickly, too, usually spitting out the first page 7-8 seconds after hitting, "print."It lacks a feature that most office printers should have, the ability to print securely. If you select this option in the print job dialog, your job won't print until you go to the printer and enter a PIN you selected when printing. This is very useful to ensure that sensivive documents don't print until you are physically at the printer waiting for them. The MB2338adw does not have this ability. There seems to be a reference to it in the manual, but I think that is a mistake.The MB2338adw does have the ability to add an additional, 550-page capacity, input tray. The built-in tray holds 250 sheets, plus there is the usual multi-purpose feeder. The addition of an extra input tray can either give you access to an additional paper size/type, or just add extra capacity of a single size so you don't have to refill as often.There is a cryptic note in the "Specs" section on the Lexmark website: "Product functions only with replacement cartridges designed for use in a specific geographical region." This appears to mean that replacement cartridges are locked to a specific region, sort of like DVDs; I've personally never heard of this and am just speculating. That may or may not be an issue, but is something you should be aware of.The print quality is outstanding.The all-in-one also sends and receives faxes, but I don't have a landline, so I couldn't test either.Overall, this is a good printer, but with its limitations vs the MB2442adwe, my recommendation is to spend the extra $40 or so to get the additonal features of that printer.

title: Not User Friendly
body: It is itself a nice all in one printer, but the whole Lexmark software were not user-friendly. I spent hours trying to install the printer, using the CD, then trying to use the online program. Each software needed to be installed to use the app was too much. I believe Lexmark is not user-friendly enough. The printer also stopped working properly after having gone through a power outage, even after re-installation. Will be returning this item.

title: prints fast and clear, set up a bit of a pain
body: Set-upCame with image only instructions, which seemed minimalist past the point of customer service to me. I figured everything out, but a little bit of text wouldn't have hurt to make things go more smoothly and quickly.I could not get the mobile app to work on either my iPhone or iPad in terms of setting it up. Once I switched to just using the keypad it was fine save for one issue (detailed below). Otherwise it went smoothly and connected easily and quickly to my home wifi.That issue was an error message about the SMTP server. Eventually, going online, I found out it had to do with email and the fax and how to turn it off.SizeIt's bigger than even our biggest inkjet by a good margin. Twice as high as most of them, and 1 1/2 times our biggest. It can sit on a table, but I wouldn't put it on a desk I'm working at. I'd call it "manageable" size. We have it under a desk in a spare room so tucked out of sight. But if the desk was ever used, it'd be tough to find a place to put it where it wasn't at the least highly noticeable and at worst obtrusive. We might have cleared out some floor space in a closet I'm guessing. It certainly doesn't "blend in", but it's not massive or hulking.UseIt was immediately recognized by all our sundry devices on the network--phones, laptops, tablets, desktops (all Apple products) and printed from all easilyPrinting is super fast. I actually thought when the first sheet came out "Oh man, what went wrong" because it never crossed my mind it had actually printed a two-sided full-text document that quickly. We've had all inkjet in our house, so don't know if this is due to this particular machine or laser printers in general, but it certainly was a speed jump compared to our inkjet (which aren't ancient--the most recent is only a few months old)Text was clear, dark, and preciseGood amount of papergenerally cheaper than inkjet based on design. We'll have to wait a while to update this on how long the the ink lasts in this particular deviceQuietWe'll use this as our "beast of burden" for text and major printing/copying (two teachers in the house) and reserve the inkjets for pictures/illustrations and for those times we're lazy and want to print just where we are sittingSo far we really like this save for the few blips on setting it up.

title: When you have to have perfect printing
body: Laser printers are a marvel of engineering. They print perfectly. Until you get near the end of the cartridge, then you might get some skips. Overall, the print quality is superior to ink jets. This printer met my expectations. It is easy to set up and use and having the wireless network works well. I can sit in my living room and print from my laptop, my phone from the bedroom and my computer in the office. I love that.

title: LOVE laser printers
body: Easiest set up for me thought I've been using different makes of laser printers so I'm a bit familiar.No more dried up ink cartridges every time you need to print. The toner cartridge will last the average household at least a year and it's not going to be dry 2 months from now when you need a printed paper! Most have gotten away from printed filing but, if you do, then laser printers are great and I've always been a fan of Lexmark.Years ago laser printers were for 'big' businesses only due to pricing. Now they're affordable and they are available in color print too. I have found that color really isn't needed for anything we do in our business or house. If I have something that needs color, I upload it and have it printed at an online site or take it on a thumb drive to a local store to print. IF you need any type of printing in your home or office - laser printing is the best in my opinion.Can you tell I absolutely LOVE laser printers?! I have an office in my home for business and I need a printer. Every time I needed to use the old ink jets - the ink would be dry and not print correctly. Then I'd have to go through the print head cleans and thate whole big, waste of time, thing. If this toner print seems to be getting light, I remove the cartridge and tip it back and forth to move the powder toner around and it will be fine (this only happens when it's getting to the end.)I do a lot of printing and I only use one cartridge a year, sometimes I start a second with a month or so remaining.There's only one issue if you're printing labels and that is mentioned in the 'cons' below.In short - the pros -*Toner Cartridge will last and last with no ink to dry up.Saves money over time and no aggravation with dried up ink 2 months from now.*Wireless*Can scan, fax and copythe cons ---* it's a bigger footprint than the compact 'print only' options.*toner cartridges are pricey (but not in comparison to ink and shelf life)*black printing only on this particular monotone model*inside does run hot*i found that some labels will get 'stuck' more than others and a jam can sometimes be 'tricky' with the hot parts.it doesn't happen often though - not often enough for me to even consider going back to ink cartridges!

body: Works great, but I didn't realize there are two possible things to replace - ink and another cartridge. Would not buy again if I knew how expensive it's going to be for these replacement parts - on the good side, the cartridges they included are still working.

title: Built Like a Tank
body: I have an older model MX310dn that I have had for years at my office. It is a workhorse. I expect no less from this model.I purchased this newer model and actually consider the MX317dn to be a downgrade to the older model because Lexmark is not providing the high capacity 10,000 sheet toner for the unit like they did for the older model. This is why I dinged the model on this review as well as the lack of clarity in instructions as discussed below.If you want wireless printing, you will have to purchase the Lexmark MarkNet 8352 802.11b/g/n wireless card. I got lucky and found the wireless unit new for $20. The instructions that came with it are incorrect regarding the instal. It also comes with the wrong cables and nowhere in the instructions of the printer or the wireless card did it instruct me to lift up a hidden panel to the left of the info screen, slide off the cover off on the wireless unit, and install the cable to the unit that is hidden inside the printer. I've attached a photo to show where the hidden cable is and where the wireless unit goes.I was disappointed that the scanner is not a true duplex scanner, unless I am missing how to use this function somehow. On the flip side the printer is duplex.The Good:I got this on Black Friday Weekend for $105prints fastDuplex printerSolid build - should last for yearsWireless works well - once you figure out how to install itHas drivers for Linux that utilize all functions of the printer - drivers installed automatically in Ubuntu 17.10The bad:Lack of clear instructions regarding hidden wireless compartmentNo high capacity toner cartridge available at this timeNo wireless - you have to purchase and install it separatelyNo mechanical duplex scanning

title: Operates beautifully. Fast clear copies
body: Operates beautifully. Fast clear copies. Easy printing with Mac OSX 10.13 even though presently only available download Driver is for 10.12. Set up instructions are not as clear as other brands (HP, Xerox) but the speed and quality of print runs circles round the HP ink jets and Xerox laser jet 6027 (to be fair, the Xerox 6027 produces Brilliant colored copies and this Lexmark is BW only). This is a great machine for a small law office like mine.

title: Lexmark MX317 printer copier scanner - good machine but mediocre instructions
body: Copier and printer seem very good; instructions are chaotic. I haven't tried scanning photos yet. Here's the good, the bad and the ugly. The copier (fairly large...more like an office printer) came with a one page (front & back) photo/symbol instruction sheet with no verbiage. I discovered 2 slightly different user guides on the web...the major difference being the connector panel configuration in the rear. Using and de-cyphering the no language, symbols only sheet, I removed all the tape (way more than the four shown on the sheet) and removed the 2 cartridges, rotated them 3X and then reinserted. I was accustomed to pulling a plastic film/tab on other cartridges; Lexmark doesn't use them but they did have a complex plastic harness on one, for want of a better description. The single, non verbiage sheet then clearly shows NOT CONNECTING the MX317 to the computer....this is INCORRECT; I assume the sheet is referring to Lexmark's other model, which is wireless and more expensive. You will need to purchase a USB (a) to USB (b) cable (search Amazon "USB to printer cable") and connect the printer to the PC. The instructions show connecting the printer cable (to a router) which won't work since this is the (cheaper) printer connected to a PC model; then the sheet instructs you to turn the printer on (step 14) and lastly inserting the enclosed CD (step 15). I assumed the CD loaded the print driver; which it does,.....BUT...it also contains the step by step instructions (30+ pages or so) in English so....INSERT the disk FIRST and follow these CD instructions...which contradict the single page hieroglyphics sheet. The CD instructs the user to NOT connect the printer cable until the last step. So...to summarize...insert the disk into your PC and follow or print out the CD's instructions. ignore the single sheet hieroglyphics unless you can't read English ..unpack and set up the printer/copier....connect the printer to your PC using a USB to printer ("A" to "B" USB) cable which you must purchase, and follow the setup/programming instructions on the CD disk.... You will also have to program the copier/printer using its "console" buttons (select language, time zone, functionality....FTP = file transfer protocol which I don't recommend: if you choose FAX...you'll need to input (and have connected) a land line telephone number. Hope this commentary helps. As the other reviewers have noted, this copier/printer is a bargain unless you are wanting a wireless printer...but even that will still require two cables.

title: Great Quality Medium Duty Printer
body: I ordered two of them and they work great in a medium demand office. Pay close attention on the initial startup as you select your options. Some options are NOT available if you do not select them on the initial boot up. Then you have to reset the box to factory default to enable items like scan to email or scan to a SMB location.I almost dinged it one star for that but honestly if you take your time and read the start items rather than zipping through them you cant go wrong.

title: You won’t find a better deal or a better printer/MFC
body: Hey guys,I just wanted to share my thoughts on this machine. Previous multifunction fax printer was having issues and despite it being less than nine months old (it was a canon), we had had enough and we’re looking for replacement. Years ago I owned a Lexmark printer. It served me very well, was a workhorse, and I honestly had no complaints and could not have been happier with it. When I was initially looking at this printer I was a bit hesitant. For starters, it being so heavily discounted gave me pause. I was concerned that perhaps people had experienced issues with this model and The remaining stock was being liquidated. I could not have been more wrong. After its initial set up, this machine has been the best fax/printer that we have ever had. It prints quickly with sharp text and images, spools quickly, and has a very speedy fax modem. The fact of the matter is, you won’t find a better deal on an enterprise grade machine that works so well and is so reliable. I will say that, as others have said, if you’re going to use this machine on a local network it would be important to have technical skills. I’m not using it for that purpose since I only connected to one computer. But there are apps available that allow you to print wirelessly via whatever computer you have connected to this printer or any other for that matter. It really is built like a tank. I’m pretty sure this thing could take take a couple of bullets and keep on printing. Just be aware that this is a machine intended for an enterprise environment. That’s not to say that it couldn’t be used in a home office or a small business. Just be aware that this is not a $100 inkjet that you could pick up at Best Buy. The network settings menu is for the technically inclined. With that being said, I am by no means a network engineer. I know how to set up basic Wi-Fi networks in my home and little more. When I received this MFC, I opened the enormous box and plugged in the power, tel, and USB cables and called it a day. If you do not intend to use this on a network, just know that it most definitely can be used in that way and if you do you have the know-how to establish this device on the network you can do that as well. We really have been so impressed by this machine. Lexmark can make a heck of a printer. Grab one before they are completely sold out... you won’t regret it.

title: One Star
body: this is pos it has never worked more than a week at a time.

title: lexmark is number 1
body: Great printer fast printing.

title: The carts themselves feel like they are 1/4 full
body: This printer is a huge scam. This printer uses a cartridge that is the same shape and size as the toner cartridges for the mx310. Exact same shape and size. My company at one time purchased 8 mx310 printers and I purchased the toner for them. I never bought the toner directly from lexmark or the lexmark branded toner because the toner cartridges were like $300. You could get them much cheaper from companies that refill them and pay about $80. Now none of those companies that refill them can refill the cartridges for the mx317 for some reason. The lexmark branded cartridges for the mx317 are exactly the same shape and size as the ones for the mx310 but they fill the cartridges up maybe 33% of the way. the toner carts only last 2500 pages. Most other laserjet printers and their toner cartridges will print anywhere from 5000 to 10000 for roughly $80 to $150. That is an acceptable price per print. These printers work with cartridges that only do 2500 prints and the carts cost $75-100. That is unacceptable. The carts themselves feel like they are 1/4 full. I have been ordering toner for roughly 10 different printers for the past 5 years. I know the weight and feel of every one of these carts. The carts for this mx317dn are the exact same size and shape as the 50F1X00 and yet the 50F1X00 will do 10,000 prints and this cart is rated for 2500? that is BS.

title: Three Stars
body: Good Mono Laser printer but beware it needs 2 kinds of ink cartridges, one is very pricey!
